segment.source: Network security Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) servers (Windows 10)
segment.target: Network security Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) servers (Windows 10)

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management and security considerations for the Network security Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) servers security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management and security considerations for the Network security Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) servers security policy setting.

segment.source: Network security: Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) servers
segment.target: Network security: Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) servers

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management and security considerations for the Network security: Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) servers security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management and security considerations for the Network security: Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) servers security policy setting.

segment.source: This policy setting allows a client device to require the negotiation of 128-bit encryption or NTLMv2 session security.
segment.target: This policy setting allows a client device to require the negotiation of 128-bit encryption or NTLMv2 session security.

segment.source: These values are dependent on the Network security: LAN Manager authentication level policy setting value.
segment.target: These values are dependent on the Network security: LAN Manager authentication level policy setting value.

segment.source: Setting all of these values for this policy setting will help protect network traffic that uses the NTLM Security Support Provider (NTLM SSP) from being exposed or tampered with by a malicious user who has gained access to the same network.
segment.target: Setting all of these values for this policy setting will help protect network traffic that uses the NTLM Security Support Provider (NTLM SSP) from being exposed or tampered with by a malicious user who has gained access to the same network.

segment.source: That is, these settings help protect against man-in-the-middle attacks.
segment.target: That is, these settings help protect against man-in-the-middle attacks.

segment.source: The connection fails if strong encryption (128-bit) is not negotiated.
segment.target: The connection fails if strong encryption (128-bit) is not negotiated.

segment.source: The connection fails if the NTLMv2 protocol is not negotiated.
segment.target: The connection fails if the NTLMv2 protocol is not negotiated.

segment.source: Enable all values that are available for this security policy.
segment.target: Enable all values that are available for this security policy.

segment.source: Legacy client devices that do not support these policy settings will be unable to communicate with the server.
segment.target: Legacy client devices that do not support these policy settings will be unable to communicate with the server.

segment.source: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesSecurity Options
segment.target: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesSecurity Options

segment.source: The following table lists the actual and effective default values for this policy.
segment.target: The following table lists the actual and effective default values for this policy.

segment.source: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.
segment.target: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.

segment.source: This section describes features and tools that are available to help you manage this policy.
segment.target: This section describes features and tools that are available to help you manage this policy.

segment.source: Changes to this policy become effective without a device restart when they are saved locally or distributed through Group Policy.
segment.target: Changes to this policy become effective without a device restart when they are saved locally or distributed through Group Policy.

segment.source: The settings for this security policy are dependent on the Network security: LAN Manager authentication level setting value.
segment.target: The settings for this security policy are dependent on the Network security: LAN Manager authentication level setting value.

segment.source: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.
segment.target: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.

segment.source: Network traffic that uses the NTLM Security Support Provider (NTLM SSP) could be exposed such that an attacker who has gained access to the network can create man-in-the-middle attacks.
segment.target: Network traffic that uses the NTLM Security Support Provider (NTLM SSP) could be exposed such that an attacker who has gained access to the network can create man-in-the-middle attacks.

segment.source: Enable all options that are available for the Network security: Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) servers policy setting.
segment.target: Enable all options that are available for the Network security: Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) servers policy setting.

segment.source: Older client devices that do not support these security settings cannot communicate with the computer on which this policy is set.
segment.target: Older client devices that do not support these security settings cannot communicate with the computer on which this policy is set.
